member.name: ID3D11VideoContext1.CheckCryptoSessionStatus
member.summary: Checks the status of a crypto session.
member.param: Specifies a for which status is checked.
A D3D11_CRYPTO_SESSION_STATUS that is populated with the crypto session status upon completion.

returns.para: This method returns one of the following error codes.

listheader.description: An invalid parameter was passed or this function was called using an invalid calling pattern.
There is insufficient memory to complete the operation.

member.name: ID3D11VideoContext1.DecoderEnableDownsampling
member.summary: Indicates that decoder downsampling will be used and that the driver should allocate the appropriate reference frames.
member.param: A pointer to the interface.
The color space information of the reference frame data.
The resolution, format, and colorspace of the output/display frames. This is the destination resolution and format of the downsample operation.
The number of reference frames to be used in the operation.

returns.para: This method returns one of the following error codes.

listheader.description: An invalid parameter was passed or this function was called using an invalid calling pattern.
There is insufficient memory to complete the operation.

member.name: ID3D11VideoContext1.DecoderUpdateDownsampling
member.param: A pointer to the interface.
The resolution, format, and colorspace of the output/display frames. This is the destination resolution and format of the downsample operation.

returns.para: This method returns one of the following error codes.

listheader.description: An invalid parameter was passed or this function was called using an invalid calling pattern.
There is insufficient memory to complete the operation.

member.name: ID3D11VideoContext1.GetDataForNewHardwareKey
member.summary: Allows the driver to return IHV specific information used when initializing the new hardware key.
member.param: A pointer to the ID3D11CryptoSession interface. To get this pointer, call .
The size of the memory referenced by the pPrivateInputData parameter.
The private input data. The contents of this parameter is defined by the implementation of the secure execution environment. It may contain data about the license or about the stream properties.

A pointer to the private output data. The return data is defined by the implementation of the secure execution environment. It may contain graphics-specific data to be associated with the underlying hardware key.

returns.para: This method returns one of the following error codes.

listheader.description: There is insufficient memory to complete the operation.

member.name: ID3D11VideoContext1.SubmitDecoderBuffers1
member.summary: Submits one or more buffers for decoding.
member.param: A pointer to the interface. To get this pointer, call the method.
The number of buffers submitted for decoding.
A pointer to an array of structures. The NumBuffers parameter specifies the number of elements in the array. Each element in the array describes a compressed buffer for decoding.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: ID3D11VideoContext1.VideoProcessorGetBehaviorHints
member.summary: Returns driver hints that indicate which of the video processor operations are best performed using multi-plane overlay hardware rather than method.
member.param: A pointer to the interface.
The width of the output stream.
The height of the output stream.
The format of the output stream.
The number of input streams to process.
An array of structures that specifies the format of each input stream and whether each stream should be used when computing behavior hints.
A pointer to a bitwise OR combination of values indicating which video processor operations would best be performed using multi-plane overlay hardware rather than the method.

returns.para: This method returns one of the following error codes.

listheader.description: An invalid parameter was passed or this function was called using an invalid calling pattern.
There is insufficient memory to complete the operation.

member.name: ID3D11VideoContext1.VideoProcessorGetOutputColorSpace1
member.summary: Gets the color space information for the video processor output surface.
member.param: A pointer to the interface.
A pointer to a value that indicates the colorspace for the video processor output surface.

member.name: ID3D11VideoContext1.VideoProcessorGetOutputShaderUsage
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the output surface from a call to can be read by Direct3D shaders.
member.param: A pointer to the interface.
A pointer to a boolean value indicating if the output surface can be read by Direct3D shaders. True if the surface rendered using can be read by Direct3D shaders; otherwise, false.

member.name: ID3D11VideoContext1.VideoProcessorGetStreamColorSpace1
member.summary: Gets the color space information for the video processor input stream.
member.param: A pointer to the interface.
An index identifying the input stream.
A pointer to a value that specifies the colorspace for the video processor input stream.

member.name: ID3D11VideoContext1.VideoProcessorGetStreamMirror
member.summary: Gets values that indicate whether the video processor input stream is being flipped vertically or horizontally.
member.param: A pointer to the interface.
An index identifying the input stream.
A pointer to a boolean value indicating whether mirroring is enabled. True if mirroring is enabled; otherwise, false.
A pointer to a boolean value indicating whether the stream is being flipped horizontally. True if the stream is being flipped horizontally; otherwise, false.
A pointer to a boolean value indicating whether the stream is being flipped vertically. True if the stream is being flipped vertically; otherwise, false.

member.name: ID3D11VideoContext1.VideoProcessorSetOutputColorSpace1
member.summary: Sets the color space information for the video processor output surface.
member.param: A pointer to the interface.
A value that specifies the colorspace for the video processor output surface.

member.name: ID3D11VideoContext1.VideoProcessorSetOutputShaderUsage
member.summary: Sets a value indicating whether the output surface from a call to will be read by Direct3D shaders.
member.param: A pointer to the interface.
True if the surface rendered using will be read by Direct3D shaders; otherwise, false. This may be set to false when multi-plane overlay hardware is supported.

member.name: ID3D11VideoContext1.VideoProcessorSetStreamColorSpace1
member.summary: Sets the color space information for the video processor input stream.
member.param: A pointer to the interface.
An index identifying the input stream.
A value that specifies the colorspace for the video processor input stream.

member.name: ID3D11VideoContext1.VideoProcessorSetStreamMirror
member.summary: Specifies whether the video processor input stream should be flipped vertically or horizontally.
member.param: A pointer to the interface.
An index identifying the input stream.
True if mirroring should be enabled; otherwise, false.
True if the stream should be flipped horizontally; otherwise, false.
True if the stream should be flipped vertically; otherwise, false.

member.name: ID3D11VideoContext1
member.summary: Provides the video functionality of a Microsoft Direct3D 11 device.
